Fargo College Memorial Union
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Founded in 1881, it was the first institution of higher learning in the Dakota Territory. Yankton College closed in December 1984, and its campus became the site of Federal Prison Camp, Yankton which opened four years later. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yankton_College In June 1954, the building was renamed Fargo College Memorial Union, converted to its new use by gifts from graduates of the now-defunct Fargo College. -- Grow and Varvel, Yankton, South Dakota in Vintage Postcards, 2004 [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
